Shirley Anita St. Hill Chisholm (November 30, 1924  January 1, 2005) was an 
American politician, educator, and author. In 1968, she became the first African 
American woman elected to the United States Congress, and she represented 
New York's 12th Congressional District for seven terms from 1969 to 1983.
